In Julia, Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

In Julia, you can create a function named `wrap_string` as follows:

```julia
function wrap_string(text::String; text_width::Int = 10)
    words :: Vector{String} = split(text, " ")
    line :: String = ""
    result :: String = ""

    for word in words
        if length(line) + length(word) > text_width
            line = ""
            result *= line * "\n"
        end
        line *= word * " "
    end

    return result * deleteat(split(result, r"\s+$"), 1)
end
```

This function takes a string `text` as an argument and an optional `text_width` argument with default value 10. It processes the input text word by word to check if adding another word would exceed the given text width. If so, it adds a new line before continuing.

Here's an example of how you can use this function:

```julia
julia> text = "This is a long string that needs to be wrapped at every 10 characters"

julia> wrap_string(text)
"This is a long string that needs to be\nwrapped at every 10 characters"
```

This function will break the given string into lines, ensuring no line contains more than the given text width.
